categories.name: Recyclable Materials
categories.description: Items that can be processed into new products through recycling programs

items.name: Plastic Type 1 - PET
items.description: Polyethylene Terephthalate - commonly used in water bottles and food containers
items.disposal: Rinse clean, remove caps and labels, place in recycling bin
items.tips: Most widely accepted plastic in recycling programs

items.name: Plastic Type 2 - HDPE
items.description: High-Density Polyethylene - used in milk jugs and detergent bottles
items.disposal: Rinse clean and place in recycling bin
items.tips: Very recyclable and often made into new bottles

items.name: Paper & Cardboard
items.description: Clean paper products without plastic coating
items.disposal: Keep dry, remove any plastic components, place in paper recycling
items.tips: Contaminated paper cannot be recycled - keep clean and dry

items.name: Glass Containers
items.description: Glass bottles and jars can be recycled indefinitely
items.disposal: Remove lids, rinse clean, place in glass recycling
items.tips: Glass can be recycled endlessly without quality loss

items.name: Aluminum Cans
items.disposal: Rinse clean, crushing optional, place in metal recycling
items.tips: Aluminum recycling saves 95% of energy compared to new production

categories.name: Compostable Organic Waste
categories.description: Organic materials that can decompose naturally into nutrient-rich soil

items.name: Fruit & Vegetable Scraps
items.description: Fresh produce waste that composts easily
items.disposal: Add to home compost bin or municipal organic waste collection
items.tips: Chop large pieces for faster decomposition

categories.name: Hazardous Waste
categories.description: Materials that require special handling due to toxicity or danger

items.name: Batteries
items.description: Contains heavy metals and chemicals that can leak into the environment
items.disposal: Take to designated hazardous waste collection sites
items.tips: Never throw batteries in regular trash - they can cause fires and pollution

items.name: Paints & Solvents
items.description: Includes oil-based paints, thinners, and solvents that are toxic
items.disposal: Bring to hazardous waste drop-off locations
items.tips: Check local guidelines for proper disposal methods

categories.name: E-Waste
categories.description: Electronic devices that can be recycled or reused

items.name: Old Electronics
items.description: Devices that are no longer in use or broken
items.disposal: Take to e-waste recycling centers or special collection events
items.tips: Many components can be reused or recycled - never throw in regular trash

items.name: Batteries & Chargers
items.description: Includes chargers and batteries from electronic devices
items.disposal: Recycle at e-waste centers or designated drop-off points
items.tips: Check for local e-waste recycling programs

categories.name: General Waste
categories.description: Items that cannot be recycled or composted and must go to landfill

items.name: Non-Recyclable Plastics
items.description: Plastics that are not accepted in recycling programs
items.tips: Check local guidelines as some areas have special collection for plastic bags

items.name: Ceramics & Porcelain
items.description: Items made of ceramic or porcelain that cannot be recycled
items.tips: Wrap sharp pieces to prevent injury when disposing
